data.title: Resolve looplength bug in xaudio
data.body: Xaudio2 requires loop length in samples and takes channels into account so existing was factor of 2 out in mono, factor of 4 out in stereo. Seems the new SoundEffect(byte[] overloads were the only ones effected (fromStream already had correct values)

data.title: [Content Pipeline] SpriteFont characters are missing
data.body: When generating a spritefont many of the extended latin characters are missing. I will post an example later today.

data.title: Fixed character region parsing in FontDescription
data.body:
First off, the default ASCII characters were always included.

Second, the CharacterRegion was ignored due to incorrect deserialization.
Example:

```
      <CharacterRegion>
        <Start>32</Start>
        <End>127</End>
      </CharacterRegion>
```

This was deserialized as "add characters from `3` to `1`", which added nothing.

Thanks to these two mistakes the character region was always 32-126.

data.title: FontDescriptionProcessor texture size fix
data.body: Do not require square, power of two textures in FontDescriptionProcessor if compression is not used. The same change was already done in FontTextureProcessor.

data.title: Added Part 7 Tutorial Link to Microsoft Tutorials.
data.body: This tutorial was not authored by a Microsoft resource and is not sanctioned by Microsoft. However, because the tutorial is a progression of the existing tutorials (dead for two years) I have decided to place it with the others.

data.title: Running inside Windows Forms
data.body:
Is there actually any way to run the develop branch inside a windows form?

I found a way to run the latest 3.2 stable version inside a form, but this method doesn't work wiht the develop version throwing me a nullreference exception (using the method linked on the website).

data.title: Content Serialization Fixes
data.body:
This PR implements a bunch of fixes for the content serialization process.

I started by converted the existing `IntermediateSerializer` unit tests to also call the `ContentCompiler` to generate an XNB and then the `ContentManager` to load the serialized type.  This round tripping exposed several bugs where the `IntermediateSerializer` worked correctly to XNA behavior, but either the `ContentCompiler` failed to serialize the type into XNB format correctly or the  `ContentManager` couldn't load the compiled content type.

Note I considered writing separate `ContentCompiler` and `ContentManager` tests, but for these binary serializations it seems like the resulting code would have been extremely redundant to what the  `IntermediateSerializer` tests already did.

So this extra testing solved a few different bugs:
- We were not including the underlying type when serializing `EnumWriter<T>`.
- We were not including the base type when serializing with the `ReflectiveWriter<T>`.
- Fixed serialization and deserialization of polymorphic types (Fixes #2817).
- Fixed case where non-public getters were being ignored.
- Implemented getter for `FontDescription.CharacterRegions`.
- `OpaqueDataDictionary` was missing the content "item name" attribute.
- We now use `CanDeserializeIntoExistingObject` to serialize getter only properties.
- Fixed a few cases where `existingInstance` wasn't being obeyed.
- Cleaned up `ContentReader` removed a lot of redundant code.
- Added clear exception when the `typeReaderIndex` is out of bounds.

Now I haven't tested this beyond just the unit tests.  It is possible a broke something, so it would be great for people with lots of content in their game to give this a test before we merge things.

Thanks to @Firedragonweb for poking me on this!

data.title: Picked up this tutorial series with Part 7.
data.body: I decided to pick up where this tutorial left off.  In part seven I add the next logical step.  Lasers!  I attempt to remain true to the original design and code style started by Tara Walker.

data.title: Implemented GraphicsDevice.SetVertexBuffers(...)
data.body: This is a re-write of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1767/. I say re-write because GraphicsDevice.cs has changed so much since that PR that I had to handle each changed block manually.

data.title: [Content Pipeline] SongProcessor throws NullReferenceException on Mac
data.body:
I get this when I try to process an MP3:

```
Processor 'SongProcessor' had unexpected failure!
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ConvertAudio.Convert (System.String input, System.String output, AudioFormatType targetFormat, AudioFileType containerType, ConversionQuality quality) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.ConvertFormat (ConversionFormat formatType, ConversionQuality quality, System.String targetFileName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.SongProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2[Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.SongContent].Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process (System.Object input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent (MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

data.title: Mac pipeline tool
data.body:
I haven't found any other issues regarding the pipeline tool on OS X, so I decided to post them.

At launch, there is a warning that says that the fonts are missing (like Consolas). I don't know if this is to be fixed or will be ignored.

Top menus have no titles, but are actually working:
![pipeline top](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/431167/5423894/0acc5926-82d7-11e4-80df-e9e1f8e69e87.png)

The left side of the UI always stays like this. The right side shows the build output correctly.
![pipeline ui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/431167/5423895/0acd02e0-82d7-11e4-922d-725323dc1d14.png)

data.title: Add a context menu to the output window with Copy and Select all buttons.
data.body: Fixes issue #3265.

data.title: SDL 1.2 deprecated
data.body:
According to https://wiki.libsdl.org/Support , SDL 1.2 is now deprecated.
Right now (at least on the Linux platform), SDL 1.2 is used in support for Gamepads and the MediaPlayer component. 

The gamepad api between SDL 1.2 and SDL 2.0 is virtually the same, and probably only needs an update of the bindings (perhaps SDL2#?)

The SDL_mixer 2.0 API I'm not quite sure about, but the current implementation leaves a lot to be desired, especially since it means that a game will be opening 2 audio devices which perhaps might not even go through the same backend (OpenAL could go through pulse, and SDL might go through alsa), which on certain systems with multiple sound cards, would be a pain to the user. NVorbis has a sample of integration with OpenTK, and perhaps an implementation could be adapted from that? (I could have a go at that)

data.title: Pipeline tool should include a context menu in the build output pane with "Copy" entry
data.body:
Minor, maybe debatable suggestion:
It could be useful if there was a right-click menu in the content build pane. The only entries I can think of currently in the menu would be a "Copy" button, which copies the selected text to the clipboard, and a "Select All" button.

Currently, the user has to guess that Ctrl+C will work to copy build output - not that much of a guess, but still a guess.

Another option (in addition to a context menu, or without a context menu) would be adding "Copy" and "Select All" buttons to the "Edit" menu, and disable them depending on the focused pane.

data.title: Fix IndexBuffer.GetData()
data.body: Make use of offsetInBytes & elementCount parameters.

data.title: Video.GetTexture sometimes returns null
Video.Play does not wait for video to startup fully
Removed MGCB command trimming, fixes #3130
data.body:
I took a closer look at #3130 

Regarding MGCB, as far as I tested, it already supports optional quotes. `/build:<content_filepath>` works fine in command line and supports white spaces.

Back to the initial issue, @tomspilman is right, the space in `/processorParam:FirstCharacter=` gets trimmed here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/edd59dc30cb6c2d376f55a2cd46449c3e5017dd6/Tools/MGCB/CommandLineParser.cs#L295

This issue also affects the pipeline GUI tool since it uses this class to parse .mgcb files. The tool handles white spaces correctly (save/modify) but can't load them due to the parser trimming.

I have checked if it would have any consequences regarding parameter type convertion and everything seems fine.
